alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 4:01AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Whiteside, Carroll and east central Clinton Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 401 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Argo Fay, or near Mount Carroll, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Clinton, Mount Carroll, Savanna, Lanark, Milledgeville, Fairhaven, Chadwick, Coleta, Argo Fay, Thomson, Hitt, Wacker, Bulgers Hollow, Ideal, Franklin Corners, Carroll County Fairgrounds, Penrose, Center Hill and Thomson Causeway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for northwestern Illinois.
